Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory713.jpg'}
{3: 'A few days later, at the Church of Machina.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Zavier', 3: "Boy, that's a shame...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'We could have totally fixed your friend and restored his memory model if we used the technology by the same humanoid-hybrid as you.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: "Would have been very nice of you if you'd shown me some more trust.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'And as I said, what a real shame.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Spooner', 3: 'I disagree, though.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'He picked his own path, and I had no intention of getting in his way.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'Well, so be it, then.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: "Say, how's Hanying doing?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'She... is back in Kowloong now.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'But she just came back here, no?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'When Hanying took Arcana up on her invitation, Arcana told her that she could stay in Kowloong and help her kind.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'Well, that... is great, no? I mean, given how little we know about how they make their machines in Kowloong.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Making a sucking noise with its mouth, Zavier fiddles with the invention in his hands.'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'Yes? Anything else?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: "I can't help but remember how Arcana looked when Hanying took her up on her invitation a few days ago...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'Oh, you have no clue, do you?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'You see, "The Hanged Man" didn\'t get "replaced" because of a natural cause.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'You mean... Hanying?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'I was talking about the last "Hanged Man".', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: "And this is what happened a long time ago. Well, a bit over a decade ago, I think, and you weren't around then.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'Because of what happened at the Church, the guy who was assigned the role of "The Hanged Man" died the very same day he joined the Church.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: "And they hadn't found a replacement since—until Sage woke Hanying up.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: '...The guy died the very same day he joined the Church, you said?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: "Right, and I guess this is probably what was going through Arcana's mind when she had that look on her face a few days ago.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'And up until that point, every single "Hanged Man" was replaced because of unnatural causes—to the point that it overtook "The Chariot" and "Wheel of Fortune".', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'And... we thought Hanying just might be able to steer clear of the same fate, given that she technically "died" once.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Says Zavier as it touches its non-existent chin.'}
{2: 'Zavier', 3: 'But who knows, right?', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory711.jpg'}
{1: 'DialogEnable'}
{3: "In the depths of the second prison down on the Nighter's orlop, a little while earlier."}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: "So, I hope you've been enjoying your suffering so far.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'A man walks into the otherwise empty prison cell, his face silhouetted with his back against the sun. The Cradle, however, has no trouble recognizing the name.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cradle', 3: "You didn't come here to poke fun at me now, did you?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "We're both nothing more than dead corpses trapped in coffins of the past, Yin. Well, yours is probably a little more expensive than mine, I suppose.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Yin', 3: "...I see you're the same old.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'And so is that ugly face of yours.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Yin', 3: 'They\'ve got most of your people up the mountain, and we just heard from the city that that "old friend" of yours is dead, too.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Yin', 3: "In short, you're all done for, every last one of you.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Unfazed by Yin's derisive tone, The Cradle remains seated squarely in his plank bed, his eyes fixated on the porthole."}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Well, we were all done for a long time ago.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "What goes around comes around, and I'm sure they saw this coming.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "And given how old he is... this didn't hit me as a surprise at all.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Yin', 3: "Right, and I'm here to help you face the music.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'With it, Yin pulls something out of his pocket and places it on the plank bed.'}
{3: "It's a pistol."}
{2: 'Yin', 3: "I brought this here for you, and it's got a single bullet in there.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "Say, you don't think I'm going to rat you out, do you?", 4: '2'}

{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'What happened was written in Kowloong\'s history—keeping a group of assassins and assassinating the Lord of the Kowloong. Well, I guess the "Would-be Lord of Kowloong" would have been a much more fitting title.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Do you really think everything you did will just go poof if you wipe me out?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Yin', 3: "...You're the last one among your people that lived through what had happened.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Yin', 3: 'So I thought this end befitting for you.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Saying not a word, The Cradle reaches for the pistol and picks it up.'}
{3: 'The gun weighs heavily in his hand.'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'An end... befitting the last one of us, huh?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: 'Interesting how it all unfolds as she said it would.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Tightening his trembling hands around the gun, The Cradle trains it straight—at Yin.'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "Easy. Just testing to see if I'm still alive.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "Hahahaha. Scared, aren't you?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "On second thought, why would you be, though? I'm pretty sure you have another one handy up your sleeve somewhere."}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "But you should be—because I'm one the last of the Nighter's prisoners, and it makes perfect sense that I die here.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "In this time, though, you won't find yourself another ship that will be able to carry you.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cradle', 3: "It's time I said my last words now, isn't it? A shame, indeed...", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory180.png'}
{3: 'Looking out of the city from the top of the Observatory, one can see the white line where the sea and the sky meet just right beyond the port.'}
{3: "Over at the top of the city sits a flower pond that's been out of maintenance for far too long. Ruffled by a sudden gust of wind, the water in the pond ripples away at the unkempt wisterias."}
{1: '1', 3: 'This is her favorite spot from which to enjoy a sweeping view of Kowloong—be it in the past or now.'}

{3: 'Plume might be the one governing and responsible for the city, but when her wings touch upon all that she can see now, she realizes that the city can give her no more in return than what she can give the city.'}
{3: 'Reciprocity—such is the principle upon which everything operates.'}
{3: "Following a tremor in the air, Bai Gui's projection appears by Qu."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 3: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bai Gui', 3: "Ma'am, they're back from the ship.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: "The medics are still up at the Observatory, and I've asked them to get the thing you need ready.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'Thank you, Bai Gui.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: "Don't mention it, ma'am... There is just this one thing I haven't quite wrapped my head around, though.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: 'Based on the information we have, those people living outside the city seem self-sufficient, and they even carried those Central Purification Filters into the city.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: 'I was just wondering if we really had to go out of our way to do everything we have for them and their children...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: 'When they made the choice of fleeing home while we were caught up in fighting the Punishing?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'I wonder if the people of Kowloong see us any differently, though.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'Kowloong treats all fairly—whether they once deserted the city and felt ashamed of being who they were, or had the burning urge in them to once again set foot in the city.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'We never hesitate to crucify those who have wronged or betrayed Kowloong.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'But... a mother never turns away her children.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Traversing the battle-scarred Observatory and past the dimly lit ship, the wind carries on toward where the sea and the sky meet.'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory162.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Villier', 3: "I'm so sick of the ever-changing politics and all the mind games.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Villier', 3: 'The Science Council is developing this technology that they call "Gestalt"—and I\'m going to join them.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Villier', 3: 'The only way to rid us of the imperfections in us and bring us ever closer to perfection... is through absolute logic and rationality.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory180.png'}
{2: 'Villier', 3: 'Pathetic that it never hit you all these years...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Villier', 3: "That governance is nothing more than a relationship that's built upon the mutual pretense and imbecility of he who governs and he who is governed.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Villier', 3: "Haha. No, you don't get it at all.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory167.jpg'}
{2: 'Villier', 3: 'You have no right to name her.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Villier', 3: '...Her name is Huaxu.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Villier', 3: "And she's going to be the only impeccable existence in this city.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory180.png'}
{1: '1', 3: 'She never meant to blame her blood brother.'}
{3: 'Her pedigree and her birth in Kowloong are what set her life in stone.'}
{3: 'She was always meant to be one lone finch that sang only for Kowloong—and to the world, one is already one too many.'}
{3: 'What would have been her chosen path, though, had she had the privilege to choose her own course of life?'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'You might have tried very hard to rid yourself of the imperfections in you and bring yourself ever closer to perfection, Villier...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: "Interesting how the machines you'd made turned out more human than you, no?", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 3: '2'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'Anything else I can do for you?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: "I just got a message from Fuxi saying that they're almost done with the data you need.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'Great. Do with it as I said.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: 'This might be a stupid question, but are we really just going to show people the data of Tabula Akasha?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'I see it as a way for us to express our gratitude to her.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: 'I see... and there is just this other thing.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: "We had a woman from Babylonia visiting us at Kowloong a few days ago that we'd never seen before.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: 'She went to the Nighter first thing coming to Kowloong, and she seemed to have spoken with some people on the Nighter.', 4: '2'}
{3: "With it, Bai Gui's projection now shows a photograph."}
{3: 'The picture is of a run-down breakfast canteen—with a bizarrely dressed woman seemingly conversing with Chaofeng, who sits across her.'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: "I presume you know her, ma'am?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'Do you remember Duheng?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: 'Duheng... Duheng from the Astroverse Bureau, I presume?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: 'But he died protecting the city, if my memory serves me correctly.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'Yes—except his wife took his name and lived on, because I asked her to not return to Kowloong to avoid the battle.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: "She's aged quite a bit over the years.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: "She hasn't reached out to us at all ever since...", 4: '2'}

{2: 'Qu', 3: "And she might not be the most active of people, but she does things with plans and never backs away from what's difficult, so I'm sure she knows what she wants out of her life.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bai Gui', 3: "I see. I will take my leave now, ma'am.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 4: '2'}
{3: "Following a wave of white noise, Bai Gui's voice vanishes."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Qu', 3: 'A smart strategist knows better than to get involved in the war itself...', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory248.png'}
{3: 'Past midnight, living souls are a rare sight down at the port by which the Nighter is docked.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Hanying stands quietly by the sea, sizing up the ship that many call their home.'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Why, hello there.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: "Fancy seeing you here. People kept saying how you'd left for Kowloong. Are you not going back to the Nighter?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: "...I don't think I will.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'There are things I need to do in other parts of Kowloong.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: "That's great. Interesting how home could be so close yet so far, no?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: "And yourself? Aren't you going back?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: 'The lone swan knows no home—and neither do we.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: "I'm not going back—because there are things I need to do, just like you.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: 'So, where is Yoyo?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: "She's got her own things to do on the Nighter and in Kowloong. There are people she needs to protect now.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: "She's not a kid anymore.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Nodding her head, Duheng finds herself sizing up the Nighter by Hanying's side."}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: 'You should really pay Kowloong a visit sometime, though. I mean, who knows—Kowloong might just shine in all its former glory again somewhere down the road soon.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: "And let's chat over some nice tea then. On me, of course.", 4: '2'}
{3: "With a few light pats on Hanying's shoulder, Duheng walks away without casting another look."}
{1: '1', 3: 'With it, Hanying finds herself alone again by the port.'}
{3: 'Rubbing the copper card in her hand, she gazes at the ship not so far away from her.'}
{3: 'With the card that reads "XII" in her hand, she sees a hazy reflection of herself staring back this way from the surface of the water.'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'The lone swan knows no home...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'As it stays but transiently in the pond of life.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She can now tell reality from a dream.'}
{3: 'And she can now tell life from death.'}
{3: 'Which is why she no longer questions what a "heart" is—because her heart\'s very act of raising the question itself is an answer enough to the question.'}
{3: 'And now only one unanswered question left...'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg3501_02.jpg'}
{3: "The slap of the waves against the bank is reminiscent of time itself, as it ticks away on the land that's Kowloong."}
{3: 'Amidst the sound of the waves, the night grows darker still, until the green figure can be seen no more.'}
{3: 'I make home where my heart finds itself in peace.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory52.jpg'}
{3: 'On that night, deep within the embrace of Mt. Huaiwu.'}
{3: "Following the document she received a few days ago from an unknown sender, Duheng now finds herself at the doorstep of The Cradle's lab, located at the foot of the grand hall on the peak."}
{3: 'From the look of it, the lab—hidden from sight below the grand hall—now parallels in size with the temple that stands above.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Duheng', 3: 'Hidden all the way up the mountain and in the woods. Who would have guessed?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: 'And this is the "source code"?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'In the hulking vacuum tube that stands at over a dozen meters tall is an object that any human with a normal vocabulary would have a hard time describing.'}
{3: 'With specks of light in all sorts of colors emanating through its cracks, the object is a hodgepodge of parts from printed wire boards with an entanglement of wires.'}
{3: 'On it is a plethora of monitors—showing views from different locations in the mountain and the vague figures making their way through the passage.'}
{3: 'The object can probably be best described as a gigantic heart—one consisting of wires and chips, with data and electricity coursing through it as the blood.'}
{3: 'Aesthetics most likely wasn\'t a major point of concern to the designer when this electric "heart" was first built, hence all the patches seen all over it.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Duheng', 3: '...Totally goes to show the taste of that bunch of lunatics, I suppose.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Duheng shakes her head, her fingers working away over the control panel in search of what she came to look for.'}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: 'Hey, are you seeing this?', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Yes... and the data is crystal clear.'}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: "Huaxu, mechanoids, the North Asian Research Institute of Life Science and Evolution... They've got themselves a rowdy party, I see.", 4: '1'}

{2: '???', 3: "Huaxu came up with Tabula Akasha, and it's obvious that these hackers are trying to copy that. They even went as far as stealing the technology that NARI had come up with on brain science."}
{2: '???', 3: "But they only ended up replicating a tiny little part of Villier's technology, which is why they weren't able to build a second Huaxu and Tabula Akasha."}
{2: '???', 3: 'Nothing borrowed is ever ground-breaking.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Duheng', 3: 'Never hurts to give things a try... no?', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: "I don't exactly have faith in something that a bunch of lunatics come up with. Do you believe in Tabula Akasha?"}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: "It doesn't really matter if I do.", 4: '1'}

{3: 'The hard drive sitting on the panel is now transferring data at top speed. With her dry hand, she rubs the hard drive—with the same gentleness that befits either a crying newborn or an empty carnal shell.'}
{2: 'Duheng', 3: 'Well... live on as a bargaining chip for us, then.', 4: '1'}
